column4: hi, I got a new mobo today that uses UEFI - will GRUB work with this automatically (from a fresh install) or do I have to do something more?
I have not had any problems with my UEFI board
thanks - i'll give it a shot in a few hours (in work atm) but hopefully it'll work like a charm (unlike my gfx card)
!ops
what graphics card do you have?
AMD 6850
feels wrong saying AMD instead of ATI ...
haha
it was working on a prior install but it just doesn't have 3d accel anymore
I haven't had a problem with that card if you use the binary drivers from the ATI website
should in fact automatically install ones that will give you 3D from the 11.10 driver manager
any terminal magic I need to do? something like "aticonfig --initial" for example?
assuming you are on 32bit (there is a x64 one too): http://support.amd.com/us/gpudownload/linux/Pages/radeon_linux.aspx?type=2.4.1&product=2.4.1.3.42&lang=English
will do it all for you
thanks :)
download it to your home directory
reboot into recovery mode, open a terminal window
sudo chmod +x <driverfilename>
then ./<driverfilename>
awesome
on a fresh install that works every time for my 6950
